title: "Eliminating Trauma Through Memory Recall and Fascination"
first_phrase: In the previous section, we learned about how recalling traumatic memories and immediately creating a "void" state after can be beneficial. In this concluding section, we focus on the scientific support for this theory with the concept of fascination, which was demonstrated by Elizabeth Phelps of the New York University. Through her study, it was shown that it's possible to eliminate traumas by "rewriting" the mnemonic trace through a non-fearful memory within six hours of summoning the memory. This revolutionary find can help individuals with anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder.

last_phrase: In conclusion, this study offers insight into the importance of addressing past traumas and their physical manifestations in the body. By inducing fear and then systematically removing it through a brief training period, researchers were able to prove the potential effectiveness of this method in breaking the association between the fear response and a particular stimulus. This could have practical applications in therapeutic settings for those struggling with traumatic experiences and their resulting physical symptoms.
